result.execSummary:
The defendant JUSTIN K BRANTLEY was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Winnebago County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
IMPOSED with good time.  See below for credit for time served.
Concurrent with:

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample and fingerprints and photograph pursuant to Wis. Stats. 970.02(7).  IMMEDIATELY following court, contact (920) 236-4906 to schedule an appointment.  Arrangements to complete collection shall be made within 72 hours.  At time of appointment, Defendant shall provide proof of identification along with the court minutes.  Failure to comply with this order may result in either a finding of contempt of court or a criminal charge of Failure to Provide a DNA Sample pursuant to Wis. Stats., 946.52.

Bond of $500.00 applied.  Outstanding financial obligations are to be paid directly to the Winnebago County Clerk of Courts immediately after court. Payment plans are available in the Clerk of Courts office. Debts older than 90 days will be processed for civil judgment and sent to the Department of Revenue for collection including tax intercept. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. JUSTIN K BRANTLEY

records.addlTxt: Judgment of Conviction returned marked, "Attempted - Not Known..."

10:13 AM  Defendant JUSTIN K BRANTLEY in court.  Attorney Ty Gasparek in court for JUSTIN K BRANTLEY.  Prosecuting attorney Christian A. Gossett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement placed into court record by parties. Defendant advised of and waives rights.  Enters plea freely and voluntarily and proceeds to sentencing.  Victim/Witness rights complied with.

1:45 PM  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Jeanne Struve in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant JUSTIN K BRANTLEY in court.  Attorney Ty Gasparek in court for JUSTIN K BRANTLEY.  Complaint on file.  Defense acknowledges receipt of information and waives reading.  Noting a special appearance and enters a not guilty plea.  Court notes victim's rights are complied with.  Court orders bond to continue.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
CTTD(DV), CTTD, DC(DV), DC
CONDITIONS: No contact with V1, V2 or W1 in Neenah PD report # 22-13721. No contact with PRIMROSE APARTMENTS IN NEENAH. Defendant does acknowledge they've been advised who the victim(s)/witness is/are. Absolute sobriety. No alcohol consumption or possession. Comply with the Alcohol 24/7 Program. Defendant shall contact (920)232-1919 IMMEDIATELY after their court hearing to schedule an appointment to be set up on the program.  If you violate the rules of 24/7, your bond is immediately revoked and you will be jailed until such time as you can be brought before the court for a bond review hearing.  The defendant shall bring the Alcohol Monitoring Device to every hearing. Child visitation through 3rd party.

2:56 PM Prosecuting attorney Christian A. Gossett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant JUSTIN K BRANTLEY appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Emma K Blankschein & Intern Cunningham appeared by video for JUSTIN K BRANTLEY. Given/has complaint. Waive reading. The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law. The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement. The defendant authorized the Court to send text message reminders of upcoming court hearings.  Record closed @ 3:08.
